summary.span: 对包含文件或目录路径信息的 实例执行操作。

span.span: Performs operations on instances that contain file or directory path information.

summary.span: 这些操作是以跨平台的方式执行的。

span.span: These operations are performed in a cross-platform manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 路径是提供的文件或目录的位置的字符串。A path is a string that provides the location of a file or directory. 路径不一定指向磁盘; 上的位置例如，路径可能会映射到在内存中或在设备上的位置。A path does not necessarily point to a location on disk; for example, a path might map to a location in memory or on a device. 由当前平台确定路径的确切格式。The exact format of a path is determined by the current platform. 例如，在某些系统中，路径可以开始驱动器或卷字母开头，而此元素中不存在其他系统。For example, on some systems, a path can start with a drive or volume letter, while this element is not present in other systems. 在某些系统中，文件路径可以包含扩展插件，指示存储在文件中的信息类型。On some systems, file paths can contain extensions, which indicate the type of information stored in the file. 文件扩展名的格式与平台相关;例如，某些系统限制为三个字符，扩展和其他人不这样做。The format of a file name extension is platform-dependent; for example, some systems limit extensions to three characters, and others do not. 当前平台还确定的字符用于分隔路径的元素集和指定路径时，不能使用的字符集。The current platform also determines the set of characters used to separate the elements of a path, and the set of characters that cannot be used when specifying paths. 由于这些差异的字段`Path`类的某些成员的具体行为以及`Path`类是依赖于平台的。Because of these differences, the fields of the `Path` class as well as the exact behavior of some members of the `Path` class are platform-dependent. 路径可以包含绝对或相对的位置信息。A path can contain absolute or relative location information. 绝对路径完全指定的位置： 文件或目录可以唯一地标识而不考虑当前的位置。Absolute paths fully specify a location: the file or directory can be uniquely identified regardless of the current location. 相对路径指定部分的位置： 定位使用相对路径指定的文件时，当前的位置使用作为起始点。Relative paths specify a partial location: the current location is used as the starting point when locating a file specified with a relative path. 若要确定当前目录，请调用。To determine the current directory, call . .NET core 1.1 和更高版本和.NET Framework 4.6.2 及更高版本还支持对文件系统对象的是设备名称，如访问"\\？ \C:\"。.NET Core 1.1 and later versions and .NET Framework 4.6.2 and later versions also support access to file system objects that are device names, such as "\\?\C:\". Windows 上的文件路径格式的详细信息，请参阅[文件在 Windows 系统上的路径格式](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md)。For more information on file path formats on Windows, see [File path formats on Windows systems](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md). 大多数成员`Path`类不使用文件系统进行交互，且不验证是否存在指定的路径字符串的文件。Most members of the `Path` class do not interact with the file system and do not verify the existence of the file specified by a path string. `Path` 类成员的修改的路径字符串，如，文件系统中对文件的名称无效。`Path` class members that modify a path string, such as , have no effect on names of files in the file system. `Path` 成员将执行操作，但是，验证指定的路径字符串的内容并引发异常，如果该字符串包含无效的路径字符串中从返回的字符中定义的字符方法。`Path` members do, however, validate the contents of a specified path string, and throw an exception if the string contains characters that are not valid in path strings, as defined in the characters returned from the method. 例如，在基于 Windows 的桌面平台上无效路径字符可能包括引号 （"）、 小于 (\<)、 大于号 (>)、 竖线 (|)，退格符 (\b)、 null (\0) 和 Unicode 字符 16 到 18 和 20 到 25。For example, on Windows-based desktop platforms, invalid path characters might include quote ("), less than (\<), greater than (>), pipe (|), backspace (\b), null (\0), and Unicode characters 16 through 18 and 20 through 25. 成员`Path`类使您能够快速轻松地执行常见操作，例如确定文件扩展名是否属于某个路径，并将两个字符串组合成一个路径名称。The members of the `Path` class enable you to quickly and easily perform common operations such as determining whether a file name extension is part of a path, and combining two strings into one path name. 所有成员`Path`类是静态的因此可以无需具有路径的实例调用。All members of the `Path` class are static and can therefore be called without having an instance of a path. > [!NOTE] > 在接受路径作为输入字符串的成员，该路径必须是格式正确，或引发的异常。In members that accept a path as an input string, that path must be well-formed or an exception is raised. 例如，如果路径是完全限定名称，但以空格开头，在类的方法不修整路径。For example, if a path is fully qualified but begins with a space, the path is not trimmed in methods of the class. 因此，该路径的格式不正确，并且会引发的异常。Therefore, the path is malformed and an exception is raised. 同样的路径的组合不能完全限定两次。Similarly, a path or a combination of paths cannot be fully qualified twice. 例如，"c:\temp c:\windows"还会引发异常在大多数情况下。For example, "c:\temp c:\windows" also raises an exception in most cases. 请确保使用接受一个路径字符串的方法时您的路径的格式是否正确。Ensure that your paths are well-formed when using methods that accept a path string. 在接受一个路径的成员，路径可以引用的文件或只是一个目录。In members that accept a path, the path can refer to a file or just a directory. 指定的路径也可以指相对路径或服务器和共享名称的通用命名约定 (UNC) 路径。The specified path can also refer to a relative path or a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path for a server and share name. 例如，以下所有条件都可接受的路径：For example, all the following are acceptable paths: - "c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt"。"c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt" in C#, or "c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt" in Visual Basic. - "c:\\\MyDir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir"。"c:\\\MyDir" in C#, or "c:\MyDir" in Visual Basic. - "MyDir\\\MySubdir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"MyDir\MySubDir"。"MyDir\\\MySubdir" in C#, or "MyDir\MySubDir" in Visual Basic. - "\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare"在 C# 中，或"\\\MyServer\MyShare"在 Visual Basic 中。"\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare" in C#, or "\\\MyServer\MyShare" in Visual Basic. 因为对字符串执行所有这些操作时，就无法验证结果在所有方案中有效。Because all these operations are performed on strings, it is impossible to verify that the results are valid in all scenarios. 例如，方法分析将传递给它一个字符串，并从该字符串返回的扩展名。For example, the method parses a string that you pass to it and returns the extension from that string. 但是，这并不意味着在磁盘上存在具有该扩展名的文件。However, this does not mean that a file with that extension exists on the disk. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示了一些主要成员`Path`类。The following example demonstrates some of the main members of the `Path` class. [!code-cpp[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/CPP/path class.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/CS/path class.cs#1)] [!code-vb[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/VB/path class.vb#1)]

summary.span: 提供平台特定的替换字符，该替换字符用于在反映分层文件系统组织的路径字符串中分隔目录级别。

span.span: Provides a platform-specific alternate character used to separate directory levels in a path string that reflects a hierarchical file system organization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此字段可以具有相同的值作为。This field can have the same value as . `AltDirectorySeparatorChar` 和都是可用于分隔的路径字符串中的目录级别。`AltDirectorySeparatorChar` and are both valid for separating directory levels in a path string. 此字段的值为斜杠 （'/') 在 Windows 和基于 Unix 的操作系统上。The value of this field is a slash ('/') on both Windows and Unix-based operating systems. ## Examples 下面的示例显示字段的值上 Windows 和基于 Unix 的系统上。The following example displays field values on Windows and on Unix-based systems. 请注意，Windows 支持正斜杠 (通过返回的这字段) 或反斜杠 (返回由字段) 作为路径分隔符字符，而基于 Unix 的系统支持仅正斜杠。Note that Windows supports either the forward slash (which is returned by the field) or the backslash (which is returned by the field) as path separator characters, while Unix-based systems support only the forward slash. [!code-csharp[DirectorySeparatorChar](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.io/path/directoryseparatorchar/program.cs)] [!code-vb[DirectorySeparatorChar](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.io/path/directoryseparatorchar/program.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果既没有`path`也不`extension`包含句点 （.）、`ChangeExtension`添加句点。If neither `path` nor `extension` contains a period (.), `ChangeExtension` adds the period. `extension`参数可以包含多个句点和任何有效的路径字符，并且可以是任意长度。The `extension` parameter can contain multiple periods and any valid path characters, and can be any length. 如果`extension`是`null`，则返回的字符串包含的内容`path`与最后一个删除期间和之后的所有字符。If `extension` is `null`, the returned string contains the contents of `path` with the last period and all characters following it removed. 如果`extension`为空字符串，返回的路径字符串包含的内容`path`后到最后一个周期的所有字符中删除。If `extension` is an empty string, the returned path string contains the contents of `path` with any characters following the last period removed. 如果`path`不具有扩展名和`extension`不是`null`，则返回的字符串包含`path`跟`extension`。If `path` does not have an extension and `extension` is not `null`, the returned string contains `path` followed by `extension`. 如果`extension`不是`null`，并且不包含前导句点，则添加句点。If `extension` is not `null` and does not contain a leading period, the period is added. 如果`path`包含多个句点分隔的多个扩展插件返回的字符串包含的内容`path`与最后一个句点以及其后的所有字符替换为`extension`。If `path` contains a multiple extension separated by multiple periods, the returned string contains the contents of `path` with the last period and all characters following it replaced by `extension`. 例如，如果`path`是"\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.txt"和`extension`为"cs"，修改后的路径为"\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.cs"。For example, if `path` is "\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.txt" and `extension` is "cs", the modified path is "\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.cs". 不能验证返回的结果在所有方案中有效。It is not possible to verify that the returned results are valid in all scenarios. 例如，如果`path`为空，`extension`追加。For example, if `path` is empty, `extension` is appended. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示使用的`ChangeExtension`方法。The following example demonstrates a use of the `ChangeExtension` method. summary.span: 将多个字符串组合成一个路径。

span.span: Combines strings into a path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法旨在将各个字符串串联为单个字符串，表示文件路径。This method is intended to concatenate individual strings into a single string that represents a file path. 但是，如果非第一个参数包含根的路径，将忽略任何以前的路径组件，并返回的字符串开头的根的路径组件。However, if an argument other than the first contains a rooted path, any previous path components are ignored, and the returned string begins with that rooted path component. 作为一种替代方法`Combine`方法，请考虑使用或方法。As an alternative to the `Combine` method, consider using the or methods. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此方法假定第一个参数是一个绝对路径，以下自变量或自变量是相对路径。This method assumes that the first argument is an absolute path and that the following argument or arguments are relative paths. 如果这不是这种情况，和尤其是当任何后续参数将用户的字符串输入，请调用或方法相反。If this is not the case, and particularly if any subsequent arguments are strings input by the user, call the or method instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `paths` 应为要组合的路径部分的一组。`paths` should be an array of the parts of the path to combine. 如果其中一个后续路径的绝对路径，然后合并操作重置开头放弃所有以前的组合的路径的绝对路径。If the one of the subsequent paths is an absolute path, then the combine operation resets starting with that absolute path, discarding all previous combined paths. 如果中的任何元素`paths`但最后一个不是驱动器，并且不使用结尾或字符`Combine`方法将添加该元素之间的下一个字符。If any element in `paths` but the last one is not a drive and does not end with either the or the character, the `Combine` method adds a character between that element and the next one. 请注意，如果该元素中并不适合于目标平台路径分隔符结束`Combine`方法保留的原始路径分隔符字符并追加一个受支持。Note that, if the element ends in a path separator character that is not appropriate for the target platform, the `Combine` method preserves the original path separator character and appends a supported one. 下面的示例比较了 Windows 和基于 Unix 的系统上的结果时将反斜杠用作路径分隔符字符。The following example compares the result on Windows and Unix-based systems when the backslash is used as a path separator character. [!code-csharp[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.io/path/combine/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.io/path/combine/program.vb#1)] 组合路径中省略了长度为零的字符串。Zero-length strings are omitted from the combined path. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. ## Examples 下面的示例将一个字符串数组合并成一个路径。The following example combines an array of strings into a path. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`path1`不是驱动器引用 （即，"c:"或"d:"） 和定义中不会结束以有效分隔符， ，或，追加到`path1`在串联前。If `path1` is not a drive reference (that is, "C:" or "D:") and does not end with a valid separator character as defined in , , or , is appended to `path1` before concatenation. 请注意，如果`path1`中并不适合于目标平台路径分隔符结束`Combine`方法保留的原始路径分隔符字符并追加一个受支持。Note that if `path1` ends in a path separator character that is not appropriate for the target platform, the `Combine` method preserves the original path separator character and appends a supported one. 下面的示例比较了 Windows 和基于 Unix 的系统上的结果时将反斜杠用作路径分隔符字符。The following example compares the result on Windows and Unix-based systems when the backslash is used as a path separator character. [!code-csharp[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.io/path/combine/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.io/path/combine/program.vb#2)] 如果`path2`不包括根 (例如，如果`path2`不以分隔符字符或指定驱动器)，结果将是两个路径，以允许插入分隔符的串联。If `path2` does not include a root (for example, if `path2` does not start with a separator character or a drive specification), the result is a concatenation of the two paths, with an intervening separator character. 如果`path2`包含一个根`path2`返回。If `path2` includes a root, `path2` is returned. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 因此，如果`path2`包括空格 (例如，"\file.txt")，方法将追加`path2`到`path1`而不是仅返回`path2`。Therefore, if `path2` includes white space (for example, " \file.txt "), the method appends `path2` to `path1` instead of returning only `path2`. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示了如何使用`Combine`基于 Windows 的桌面平台上的方法。The following example demonstrates using the `Combine` method on a Windows-based desktop platform. [!code-cpp[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/CPP/pathcombine.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/CS/pathcombine.cs#1)] [!code-vb[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/VB/pathcombine.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `path1` 应为绝对路径 (例如，"d:\archives"或"\\\archives\public")。`path1` should be an absolute path (for example, "d:\archives" or "\\\archives\public"). 如果`path2`或`path3`也是绝对路径，合并操作将放弃所有先前合并路径和重置为该绝对路径。If `path2` or `path3` is also an absolute path, the combine operation discards all previously combined paths and resets to that absolute path. 组合路径中省略了长度为零的字符串。Zero-length strings are omitted from the combined path. 如果`path1`或`path2`不是驱动器引用 （即，"c:"或"d:"） 和定义中不会结束以有效分隔符， ，或，追加到`path1`或`path2`串联之前。If `path1` or `path2` is not a drive reference (that is, "C:" or "D:") and does not end with a valid separator character as defined in , , or , is appended to `path1` or `path2` before concatenation. 请注意，如果`path1`或`path2`中并不适合于目标平台路径分隔符结束`Combine`方法保留的原始路径分隔符字符并追加一个受支持。Note that if `path1` or `path2` ends in a path separator character that is not appropriate for the target platform, the `Combine` method preserves the original path separator character and appends a supported one. 下面的示例比较了 Windows 和基于 Unix 的系统上的结果时将反斜杠用作路径分隔符字符。The following example compares the result on Windows and Unix-based systems when the backslash is used as a path separator character. [!code-csharp[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.io/path/combine/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Combine and path separator characters](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.io/path/combine/program.vb#3)] 如果`path2`不包括根 (例如，如果`path2`不以分隔符字符或指定驱动器)，结果将是两个路径，以允许插入分隔符的串联。If `path2` does not include a root (for example, if `path2` does not start with a separator character or a drive specification), the result is a concatenation of the two paths, with an intervening separator character. 如果`path2`包含一个根`path2`返回。If `path2` includes a root, `path2` is returned. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 因此，如果`path2`包括空格 (例如，"\file.txt")，方法将追加`path2`到`path1`。Therefore, if `path2` includes white space (for example, " \file.txt "), the method appends `path2` to `path1`. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. ## Examples 下面的示例将三个路径合并。The following example combines three paths. [!code-csharp[System.IO.Path.Combine#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.path.combine/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.Path.Combine#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.path.combine/vb/program.vb#1)]

.field public static initonly char DirectorySeparatorChar
Public Shared ReadOnly DirectorySeparatorChar As Char
public: static initonly char DirectorySeparatorChar;
staticval mutable DirectorySeparatorChar : char

summary.span: 提供平台特定的字符，该字符用于在反映分层文件系统组织的路径字符串中分隔目录级别。

span.span: Provides a platform-specific character used to separate directory levels in a path string that reflects a hierarchical file system organization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 和`DirectorySeparatorChar`都是可用于分隔的路径字符串中的目录级别。 and `DirectorySeparatorChar` are both valid for separating directory levels in a path string. 当使用.NET Core 开发在多个平台运行的应用程序：When you are using .NET Core to develop applications that run on multiple platforms: - 如果您愿意硬编码目录分隔符字符，则应使用正斜杠 (`/`) 字符。If you prefer to hard-code the directory separator character, you should use the forward slash (`/`) character. 它是 Unix 系统上的唯一可识别的目录分隔符字符中的示例所示，输出的形式，在 Windows 上。It is the only recognized directory separator character on Unix systems, as the output from the example shows, and is the on Windows. - 使用字符串串联来动态检索在运行时的路径分隔符字符并将它合并到文件系统路径。Use string concatenation to dynamically retrieve the path separator character at runtime and incorporate it into file system paths. 例如，应用于对象的For example, ```csharp separator = Path.DirectorySeparatorChar; path = $"{separator}users{separator}user1{separator}"; ``` ```vb separator = Path.DirectorySeparatorChar; path = $"{separator}users{separator}user1{separator}"; ``` 此外可以检索的值从属性，因为它是 Windows 和基于 Unx 的系统上相同。You can also retrieve the value from the property, since it is the same on both Windows and Unx-based systems. - 检索属性Retrieve the property 如果你的应用程序不是跨平台，可以使用适用于您系统的分隔符。If your application is not cross-platform, you can use the separator appropriate for your system. ## Examples 下面的示例显示字段的值上 Windows 和基于 Unix 的系统上。The following example displays field values on Windows and on Unix-based systems. 请注意，Windows 支持正斜杠 (通过返回的这字段) 或反斜杠 (返回由字段) 作为路径分隔符字符，而基于 Unix 的系统支持仅正斜杠。Note that Windows supports either the forward slash (which is returned by the field) or the backslash (which is returned by the field) as path separator characters, while Unix-based systems support only the forward slash. [!code-csharp[DirectorySeparatorChar](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.io/path/directoryseparatorchar/program.cs)] [!code-vb[DirectorySeparatorChar](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.io/path/directoryseparatorchar/program.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在大多数情况下，此方法返回的字符串包含的路径，但不是包括最后一个中的所有字符或。In most cases, the string returned by this method consists of all characters in the path up to but not including the last or . 如果路径包括的根目录，例如"c:\\"，则返回 null。If the path consists of a root directory, such as "c:\\", null is returned. 请注意，此方法不支持使用路径"文件:"。Note that this method does not support paths using "file:". 因为返回的路径不包括或，将返回的路径传递回方法将导致每次在结果字符串的后续调用的一个文件夹级别的截断。Because the returned path does not include the or , passing the returned path back into the method will result in the truncation of one folder level per subsequent call on the result string. 例如，将"C:\Directory\SubDirectory\test.txt"的路径传递到方法将返回"C:\Directory\SubDirectory"。For example, passing the path "C:\Directory\SubDirectory\test.txt" into the method will return "C:\Directory\SubDirectory". 将该字符串，"C:\Directory\SubDirectory"传递到将导致"C:\Directory"。Passing that string, "C:\Directory\SubDirectory", into will result in "C:\Directory". 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示了如何使用`GetDirectoryName`基于 Windows 的桌面平台上的方法。The following example demonstrates using the `GetDirectoryName` method on a Windows-based desktop platform. [!code-cpp[System.IO.Path Members#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.Path Members/CPP/pathmembers.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.Path Members#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.Path Members/CS/pathmembers.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.IO.Path Members#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.Path Members/VB/pathmembers.vb#3)]

remarks.format: 此方法获取的扩展`path`通过搜索`path`为句点 ("。")、 从只读的范围中的最后一个字符开始，一直到第一个字符。This method obtains the extension of `path` by searching `path` for a period ("."), starting from the last character in the read-only span and continuing toward its first character. 如果之前找到一段或字符，返回只读的跨度包含该句点以及字符后它; 否则为返回。If a period is found before a or character, the returned read-only span contains the period and the characters after it; otherwise, is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 绝对路径包括所需的系统上查找文件或目录的所有信息。The absolute path includes all information required to locate a file or directory on a system. 指定目录的文件`path`不需要存在。The file or directory specified by `path` is not required to exist. 例如，如果*c:\temp\newdir*是当前目录中，调用`GetFullPath`上的文件名称，如*test.txt*返回*c:\temp\newdir\test.txt*。For example, if *c:\temp\newdir* is the current directory, calling `GetFullPath` on a file name such as *test.txt* returns *c:\temp\newdir\test.txt*. 不需要存在该文件。The file need not exist. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果`path`是相对路径，此重载方法返回可以基于当前驱动器和当前目录的完全限定的路径。If `path` is a relative path, this overload returns a fully qualified path that can be based on the current drive and current directory. 执行应用程序随时可以更改当前驱动器和当前目录。The current drive and current directory can change at any time as an application executes. 因此，不能提前确定返回的此重载的路径。As a result, the path returned by this overload cannot be determined in advance. 若要返回的确定性的路径，请调用重载。To return a deterministic path, call the overload. 您还可以调用方法，以确定是否完全限定路径或相对，因此是否调用`GetFullPath`是有必要。You can also call the method to determine whether a path is fully qualified or relative and therefore whether a call to `GetFullPath` is necessary. 但是，如果`path`确实存在，调用方必须有权获取路径信息`path`。However, if `path` does exist, the caller must have permission to obtain path information for `path`. 请注意，与不同的大多数成员类，此方法访问文件系统。Note that unlike most members of the class, this method accesses the file system. 此方法使用当前目录和卷的当前信息进行完全限定`path`。This method uses the current directory and current volume information to fully qualify `path`. 如果指定的文件命名为仅在`path`，`GetFullPath`返回当前目录的完全限定的路径。If you specify a file name only in `path`, `GetFullPath` returns the fully qualified path of the current directory. 如果您通过短文件名中，它将扩展为长文件名。If you pass in a short file name, it is expanded to a long file name. 路径不包含任何重要的字符，如果无效，除非它包含一个或多个"。"字符后跟任意数目的空格;则它将解析为"。".."。If a path contains no significant characters, it is invalid unless it contains one or more "." characters followed by any number of spaces; then it will be parsed as either "." or "..". .NET core 1.1 和更高版本和.NET Framework 4.6.2 及更高版本还支持包括设备名称，如下所述的路径"\\？ \C:\"。.NET Core 1.1 and later versions and .NET Framework 4.6.2 and later versions also support paths that include device names, such as "\\?\C:\". Windows 上的文件路径格式的详细信息，请参阅[文件在 Windows 系统上的路径格式](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md)。For more information on file path formats on Windows, see [File path formats on Windows systems](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md). 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示`GetFullPath`基于 Windows 的桌面平台上的方法。The following example demonstrates the `GetFullPath` method on a Windows-based desktop platform. remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载`IsPathFullyQualified`同时使用的方法句柄路径和字符。The overloads of the `IsPathFullyQualified` method handle paths that use both the and the characters. 它不会作为参数传递给它的路径上执行任何验证。It does not perform any validation on the path that is passed to it as an argument. 因此，Uri 将被解释为相对路径，并返回`false`。As a result, URIs are interpreted as relative paths and return `false`. 没有区别的完全限定路径 (如所示`IsPathFullyQualified`方法) 和取得 root 权限的路径 (如所示方法)。There is a difference between a fully qualified path (as indicated by the `IsPathFullyQualified` method) and a rooted path (as indicated by the method). 一个*完全限定的路径*或*绝对路径*始终定义为目标文件或目录中，从特定驱动器或设备的确切路径并不依赖于当前驱动器或当前目录。A *fully qualified path* or *absolute path* always defines an exact path from a particular drive or device to a target file or directory, and does not depend on the current drive or current directory. 例如，在 Windows 系统上*C:/users/user1/documents/reports/2019/january/highlights.pdf*定义目标文件中，从 c： 驱动器的根的绝对路径*highlights.pdf*。For example, on Windows systems, *C:/users/user1/documents/reports/2019/january/highlights.pdf* defines an absolute path from the root of the C: drive to the target file, *highlights.pdf*. 一个*根的路径*指定起始驱动器或根目录中，但依赖于当前目录 （如果它已取得 root 权限由指定的驱动器） 或当前驱动器 （如果它已取得 root 权限的根目录下）。A *rooted path* specifies either a starting drive or root directory, but depends on either the current directory (if it is rooted by a specified drive) or the current drive (if it is rooted by the root directory). 下面的示例说明了完全限定的路径和取得 root 权限的路径之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between fully qualified paths and rooted paths. [!code-csharp[IsPathRooted](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.IO/Path/IsPathRooted/program.cs)] [!code-vb[IsPathRooted](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.IO/Path/IsPathRooted/program.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个**根的路径**是文件路径的固定为特定驱动器或 UNIC 路径; 形成了鲜明对比的路径是相对于当前驱动器或工作目录。A **rooted path** is file path that is fixed to a specific drive or UNIC path; it contrasts with a path that is relative to the current drive or working directory. 例如，在 Windows 系统中，根的路径开头反斜杠 (例如，"\Documents") 或驱动器号和冒号 (例如，"C:Documents")。For example, on Windows systems, a rooted path begins with a backslash (for example, "\Documents") or a drive letter and colon (for example, "C:Documents"). 请注意取得 root 权限的路径可以是绝对 （即，完全限定的） 或相对。Note that rooted paths can be either absolute (that is, fully qualified) or relative. 取得 root 权限的绝对路径是从驱动器的根目录到特定目录的完全限定的路径。An absolute rooted path is a fully qualified path from the root of a drive to a specific directory. 取得 root 权限的相对路径指定的驱动器，但其完全限定的路径解析对当前目录。A relative rooted path specifies a drive, but its fully qualified path is resolved against the current directory. 以下示例演示了差异。The following example illustrates the difference. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法只需串联`path`并`path2`，并添加两个路径组件之间的目录分隔符字符，如果尚未存在的末尾`path1`或开始位置`path2`。This method simply concatenates `path` and `path2` and adds a directory separator character between the two path components if one is not already present at the end of `path1` or the beginning of `path2`. 如果的任一`path1`或`path2`为零，该方法返回的其他路径。If the of either `path1` or `path2` is zero, the method returns the other path. 如果两者`path1`并`path2`为零，该方法将返回。If the of both `path1` and `path2` is zero, the method returns . 如果`path1`中并不适合于目标平台路径分隔符结束`Join`方法保留的原始路径分隔符字符并追加受支持。If `path1` ends in a path separator character that is not appropriate for the target platform, the `Join` method preserves the original path separator character and appends the supported one. 中使用 Windows 反斜杠的硬编码路径，会出现此问题 ("\") 未被识别为路径分隔符基于 Unix 的系统的字符。This issue arises in hard-coded paths that use the Windows backslash ("\") character, which is not recognized as a path separator on Unix-based systems. 若要解决此问题，您可以：To work around this issue, you can: - 检索的值属性，而不是硬编码目录分隔符字符。Retrieve the value of the property rather than hard-coding a directory separator character. - 使用正斜杠 （"/"） 作为目录分隔符字符。Use a forward slash ("/") as the directory separator character. 返回此字符属性，基于 Unix 的系统上并通过Windows 系统上的属性。This character is returned by the property on Unix-based systems and by the property on Windows systems. 与不同方法， methhod 不会尝试根返回的路径。Unlike the method, the methhod does not attempt to root the returned path. (即，如果`path2`是一个绝对路径`Join`方法不会放弃`path1`并返回`path2`作为方法执行。)下面的示例说明了在两个方法返回的路径中的差异。(That is, if `path2` is an absolute path, the `Join` method does not discard `path1` and return `path2` as the method does.) The following example illustrates the difference in the paths returned by the two methods. 如果源的`path2`是用户输入方法，使用户可以访问文件系统资源 (如*c: /用户/User1/文档/财务/* 在该示例的情况下) 的应用程序执行不想要使可访问。If the source of `path2` is user input, the method makes it possible for a user to access a file system resource (such as *C:/Users/User1/Documents/Financial/* in the case of hte example) that the application did not intend to make accessible. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Join`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Join` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Join("c:\\", "*.txt")`，可能无效时，创建一个文件，它是有效搜索字符串。For example, while `Path.Join("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid when creating a file, it is valid as a search string. `Join`方法因此已成功将其解释。The `Join` method therefore successfully interprets it. ## 示例Example 下面的示例说明了返回的路径中的差异和方法。The following example illustrates the difference in the paths returned by the and methods. 当第一个字符串是包含驱动器和根的目录的完全限定的路径，第二个是从第一个路径的相对路径时，两种方法将产生相同的结果。When the first string is an fully qualified path that includes a drive and root directory and the second is a relative path from the first path, the two methods produce identical results. 第二个和第三个调用中`ShowPathInformation`方法中，两个方法返回的字符串将发生偏离。In the second and third calls to the `ShowPathInformation` method, the strings returned by the two methods diverge. 在第二个方法调用的第一个字符串参数是一个驱动器，而第二个是取得 root 权限的目录。In the second method call, the first string argument is a drive, while the second is a rooted directory. `Join`方法串联两个字符串并保留重复路径分隔符。The `Join` method concatenates the two strings and preserves duplicate path separators. `Combine`方法放弃该驱动器，并返回当前驱动器上取得 root 权限的目录。The `Combine` method abandons the drive and returns a rooted directory on the current drive. 如果应用程序的当前驱动器 C:\和此字符串用来访问文件或目录中的文件，它将访问而不是 d: c:。If the application's current drive is C:\ and the string is used to access a file or files in the directory, it would access C: instead of D:. 最后，因为这两个参数对的第三个调用中`ShowPathInformation`，并且它们植根`Join`方法只需将它们附加若要创建无意义的文件路径，而`Combine`方法会放弃第一个字符串 anmd 返回第二个。Finally, becasue both arguments in the third call to `ShowPathInformation` are rooted, the `Join` method simply appends them to create a nonsensical file path, while the `Combine` method discards the first string anmd returns the second. 使用此字符串进行文件访问权限可以授予应用程序无意中访问的敏感文件。Using this string for file access could give the application unintended access to sensitive files. (即，如果`path2`或`path2`是一个绝对路径`Join`方法不会放弃上一个路径设置为方法执行。(That is, if `path2` or `path2` is an absolute path, the `Join` method does not discard the previous paths as the method does. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Join`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Join` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Join("c:\\", "temp", "*.txt")`，可能无效时，创建一个文件，它是有效搜索字符串。For example, while `Path.Join("c:\\", "temp", "*.txt")` might be invalid when creating a file, it is valid as a search string. `Join`方法因此已成功将其解释。The `Join` method therefore successfully interprets it. ##
